page.title: 19BUILDINGS ARCHITECTURE
page.content: Houses and farm buildings from the 17 to 19th Centuries, of local building materials give the village a special character.Local stone{(S)}and clay for brick {(B) }making were both readily available. Brick works were operating in the village in the 19th Century. Dated buildings still standing:- 1672 Whitegates cottage {(S) 1683 Earlsgate Farm {(B) 1700 Hollingsworth House{(B) 1726/1888 Sycamore Farm {(S&B) 1756/1861 Towler Place {(S&B) 1781 Barn, Ferry Lane {(B) 1791 Westoby {(B) 1796 Eastfield Farm {(B) 1834 Oakdene {(S&B) 1841 Barn, West Farm {(S&B) 1845 National School {(B) 1853 Pigeon Cote {(S&B) MDCCCLX Laurel Cottage {(B)
